abstract: Zenos most famous paradox (of motion) is related to us through Aristotle, who presents Zenos problems in his Physics, 239b11-14. Aristotle asserts (on Zenos behalf) the non-existence of motion on the ground that any object in locomotion must arrive at the half-way stage before it arrives at the goal.
title: Taneys Zeno and Scalias Mobilia
subject: law
